home.title: Solidis
home.subtitle: High-performance, SOLID-structured RESP client for Redis and other RESP-compatible servers
home.whyDescription: Built with performance and reliability in mind, following SOLID principles for maintainable code.
home.highPerformanceDesc: Optimized for speed with efficient connection pooling and minimal overhead
home.solidArchitectureDesc: Clean, maintainable code following SOLID principles for better extensibility
home.typescriptFirstDesc: Full TypeScript support with comprehensive type definitions and IntelliSense
home.blazingFastDesc: Solidis delivers up to 79% faster performance than IoRedis with zero dependencies
home.getStartedDesc: Install Solidis and start building high-performance Redis applications with just a few lines of code.
home.communityDesc: Join our growing community of developers using Solidis in production
home.comprehensiveDocsDesc: Everything you need to master Solidis
home.gettingStartedCard: Step-by-step guides for beginners and experienced developers
home.apiReferenceCard: Complete API documentation with examples and type definitions
home.tutorialsCard: Learn by building real-world applications and use cases

footer.description: High-performance RESP client for Redis and other RESP-compatible servers.
footer.rights: All rights reserved. Licensed under MIT.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started with Solidis
gettingStarted.subtitle: Learn how to integrate Solidis into your project and start building high-performance Redis applications.
gettingStarted.installationDesc: Install Solidis using your preferred package manager
gettingStarted.clientTypesDesc: Choose the right client for your needs
gettingStarted.basicClientDesc: The basic client contains minimal functionality to reduce bundle size. You need to extend it with specific commands:
gettingStarted.featuredClientDesc: A convenience client with all RESP commands pre-loaded:
gettingStarted.connectionManagementDesc: Learn how to manage Redis connections
gettingStarted.apiReferenceLink: Explore the complete API documentation with detailed examples.
gettingStarted.tutorialsLink: Learn by building real-world applications with step-by-step guides.

tutorials.title: Tutorials & Use Cases
tutorials.subtitle: Learn Solidis through practical examples and real-world use cases. Each tutorial includes complete code examples and explanations.
tutorials.sessionStoreDesc: Learn how to implement a Redis-based session store for web applications using Solidis.
tutorials.cacheLayerDesc: Create a high-performance caching layer to speed up your application's database queries.
tutorials.chatAppDesc: Build a real-time chat application using Redis pub/sub with Solidis and WebSockets.
tutorials.rateLimitingDesc: Implement various rate limiting strategies using Redis and Solidis for API protection.
tutorials.distributedLockingDesc: Learn how to implement distributed locks using Redis to coordinate between multiple processes.
tutorials.jobQueueDesc: Create a robust job queue system using Redis lists and Solidis for background processing.
tutorials.learningPathDesc: Follow this path to master Solidis from basics to advanced concepts
tutorials.step1Desc: Learn the basics of installation and configuration
tutorials.step2Desc: Practice with a common real-world use case
tutorials.step4Desc: Explore distributed locking, pub/sub, and job queues

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find quick answers to common questions about Solidis. Can't find what you're looking for?
faq.stillNeedHelpDesc: If you can't find the answer you're looking for, here are some ways to get help
faq.githubDiscussionsDesc: Ask questions and get community help
